text: Now Abraham was old, well advanced in years, and the Lord had blessed him in everything.

<st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st>, the <st data-num="02205" class="">senior one</st><n id="1" /> in his <st data-num="01004" class="">household</st> who <st data-num="04910" class="">was in charge</st> of <st data-num="03605" class="">everything</st> he <st data-num="0834" class="">had</st>, “<st data-num="07760 04994">Put</st> your <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> my <st data-num="03409" class="">thigh</st><n id="2" />
so that I may make you solemnly promise by the Lord, the God of heaven and the God of the earth: You must not acquire a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I am living.
You must go instead to my country and to my relatives to find a wife for my son Isaac.”
The servant asked him, “What if the woman is not willing to come back with me to this land? Must I then take your son back to the land from which you came?”
“Be careful never to take my son back there!” Abraham told him.

“The Lord, the God of heaven, who took me from my father’s house and the land of my relatives, promised me with a solemn oath, ‘To your descendants I will give this land.’ He will send his angel before you so that you may find a wife for my son from there.

But <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> the <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="014" class="">is</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="014" class="">willing</st> to <st data-num="01980" class="">come</st> back <st data-num="0310" class="">with</st> you,<n id="1" /> you will be <st data-num="05352" class="">free</st><n id="2" /> from <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="07621" class="">oath</st> of mine. <st data-num="07535" class="">But</st> you must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">take</st> my <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">back</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>!”
So the servant placed his hand under the thigh of his master Abraham and gave his solemn promise he would carry out his wishes.
Then the servant took ten of his master’s camels and departed with all kinds of gifts from his master at his disposal. He journeyed to the region of Aram Naharaim and the city of Nahor.

He made the <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st> <st data-num="01288" class="">kneel down</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="0875 04325">well</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="02351" class="">outside</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>. It <st data-num="06256" class="">was</st> <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="06256" class="">time</st> when the women would <st data-num="03318" class="">go out</st> to <st data-num="07579" class="">draw</st> water.
He prayed, “O Lord, God of my master Abraham, guide me today. Be faithful to my master Abraham.

<st data-num="02009" class="">Here</st> <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am, <st data-num="05324" class="">standing</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="05869 04325">spring</st>,<n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st> of the <st data-num="0376" class="">people</st><n id="2" /> who live in the <st data-num="05892" class="">town</st> are <st data-num="03318" class="">coming out</st> to <st data-num="07579" class="">draw</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>.

I will say to a young woman, ‘Please lower your jar so I may drink.’ May the one you have chosen for your servant Isaac reply, ‘Drink, and I’ll give your camels water too.’ In this way I will know that you have been faithful to my master.”
Before he had finished praying, there came Rebekah with her water jug on her shoulder. She was the daughter of Bethuel son of Milcah (Milcah was the wife of Abraham’s brother Nahor).

Now the <st data-num="05291" class="">young woman</st> was <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="02896 04758">beautiful</st>. She was a <st data-num="01330" class="">virgin</st>; <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> had ever <st data-num="03045" class="">been physically intimate with</st> her.<n id="1" /> She <st data-num="03381" class="">went down</st> to the <st data-num="05869" class="">spring</st>, <st data-num="04390" class="">filled</st> her <st data-num="03537" class="">jug</st>, and <st data-num="05927" class="">came back up</st>.

Abraham’s <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07323" class="">ran</st> to <st data-num="07125" class="">meet</st> her and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="04994" class="">Please</st> <st data-num="01572" class="">give</st> me a <st data-num="04592" class="">sip</st> of <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> from your <st data-num="03537" class="">jug</st>.”

“<st data-num="08354" class="">Drink</st>, my <st data-num="0113" class="">lord</st>,” she <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, and <st data-num="04116" class="">quickly</st> <st data-num="03381" class="">lowering</st><n id="1" /> her <st data-num="03537" class="">jug</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> her <st data-num="03027" class="">hands</st>, she <st data-num="08248" class="">gave</st> him <st data-num="08248" class="">a drink</st>.

When she had <st data-num="03615" class="">done</st> <st data-num="08248" class="">so</st>,<n id="1" /> she <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “I’ll <st data-num="07579" class="">draw water</st> for your <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">too</st>, <st data-num="05704 0518">until</st> they have <st data-num="08354" class="">drunk</st> <st data-num="03615" class="">as much as they want</st>.”

She <st data-num="04116" class="">quickly</st> <st data-num="06168" class="">emptied</st><n id="1" /> her <st data-num="03537" class="">jug</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="08268" class="">watering trough</st> and <st data-num="07323" class="">ran</st> <st data-num="05750" class="">back</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="0875" class="">well</st> to <st data-num="07579" class="">draw</st> more water until she had <st data-num="07579" class="">drawn</st> enough for <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st>.
Silently the man watched her with interest to determine if the Lord had made his journey successful or not.
After the camels had finished drinking, the man took out a gold nose ring weighing a beka and two gold wrist bracelets weighing ten shekels and gave them to her.
“Whose daughter are you?” he asked. “Tell me, is there room in your father’s house for us to spend the night?”
She said to him, “I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom Milcah bore to Nahor.
We have plenty of straw and feed,” she added, “and room for you to spend the night.”
The man bowed his head and worshiped the Lord,
saying, “Praised be the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, who has not abandoned his faithful love for my master! The Lord has led me to the house of my master’s relatives!”
The young woman ran and told her mother’s household all about these things.

(Now <st data-num="07259" class="">Rebekah</st> had a <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">named</st> <st data-num="03837" class="">Laban</st>.)<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03837" class="">Laban</st> <st data-num="07323" class="">rushed</st> <st data-num="02351" class="">out</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> meet the <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="05869" class="">spring</st>.

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> he <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> the <st data-num="06781" class="">bracelets</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="0269" class="">sister’s</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">wrists</st> and the <st data-num="05141" class="">nose ring</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="08085 01697">heard</st> his <st data-num="0269" class="">sister</st> <st data-num="07259" class="">Rebekah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st>,<n id="2" /> “<st data-num="03541" class="">This is what</st> the <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="01696" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me,” he <st data-num="0935" class="">went</st> out <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> meet the <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st>. <st data-num="02009" class="">There</st> he was, <st data-num="05975" class="">standing</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">near</st> the <st data-num="05869" class="">spring</st>.
Laban said to him, “Come, you who are blessed by the Lord! Why are you standing out here when I have prepared the house and a place for the camels?”
So Abraham’s servant went to the house and unloaded the camels. Straw and feed were given to the camels, and water was provided so that he and the men who were with him could wash their feet.
When food was served, he said, “I will not eat until I have said what I want to say.” “Tell us,” Laban said.
“I am the servant of Abraham,” he began.
“The Lord has richly blessed my master and he has become very wealthy. The Lord has given him sheep and cattle, silver and gold, male and female servants, and camels and donkeys.

My <st data-num="0113" class="">master’s</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> <st data-num="08283" class="">Sarah</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">bore</st> a <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> to <st data-num="0113" class="">him</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0310" class="">when</st> she <st data-num="02209" class="">was old</st>,<n id="2" /> and my master<n id="3" /> has <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> him <st data-num="03605" class="">everything</st> he <st data-num="0834" class="">owns</st>.

My <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st> made me <st data-num="07650" class="">swear an oath</st>. He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, ‘You must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">acquire</st> a <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> for my <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> from the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st> of the <st data-num="03669" class="">Canaanites</st>, <st data-num="0776" class="">among</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am <st data-num="03427" class="">living</st>,

<st data-num="0518 03808">but</st> you must <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">family</st> of my <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> and <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> my <st data-num="04940" class="">relatives</st> to <st data-num="03947" class="">find</st><n id="1" /> a <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> for my <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.’

But I <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> my <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>, ‘<st data-num="0194" class="">What if</st> the <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> does <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> want to <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0310" class="">with</st> me?’<n id="2" />

He answered, ‘The Lord, before whom I have walked, will send his angel with you. He will make your journey a success and you will find a wife for my son from among my relatives, from my father’s family.

You will <st data-num="05352" class="">be free</st> from your <st data-num="0423" class="">oath</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">if</st> you <st data-num="0935" class="">go</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> my <st data-num="04940" class="">relatives</st> <st data-num="0518" class="">and</st> they will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> her to you. <st data-num="0227" class="">Then</st> you will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="05355" class="">free</st> from your <st data-num="0423" class="">oath</st>.’
When I came to the spring today, I prayed, ‘O Lord, God of my master Abraham, if you have decided to make my journey successful, may events unfold as follows:

<st data-num="02009" class="">Here</st> <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am, <st data-num="05324" class="">standing</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="05869 04325">spring</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01961" class="">When</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="05959" class="">young woman</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">goes out</st> to <st data-num="07579" class="">draw water</st>, I’ll <st data-num="0559 0413">say</st>, “<st data-num="04994" class="">Please</st> <st data-num="08248" class="">give</st> me a <st data-num="04592" class="">little</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> <st data-num="08248" class="">to drink</st> from your <st data-num="03537" class="">jug</st>.”
Then she will reply to me, “Drink, and I’ll draw water for your camels too.” May that woman be the one whom the Lord has chosen for my master’s son.’
“Before I finished praying in my heart, along came Rebekah with her water jug on her shoulder! She went down to the spring and drew water. So I said to her, ‘Please give me a drink.’

She <st data-num="04116" class="">quickly</st> <st data-num="03381" class="">lowered</st> her <st data-num="03537" class="">jug</st> from her <st data-num="05921">shoulder</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, ‘<st data-num="08354" class="">Drink</st>, and I’ll <st data-num="08248" class="">give</st> your <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st> <st data-num="08248" class="">water</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">too</st>.’ So I <st data-num="08354" class="">drank</st>, and she <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="08248" class="">gave</st> the <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st> <st data-num="08248" class="">water</st>.

Then I <st data-num="07592 0559">asked</st> her, ‘<st data-num="04310" class="">Whose</st> <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> are <st data-num="0859">you</st>?’ She <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, ‘The <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> of <st data-num="01328" class="">Bethuel</st> the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05152" class="">Nahor</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="04435" class="">Milcah</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">bore</st> to Nahor.’<n id="1" /> I <st data-num="07760" class="">put</st> the <st data-num="05141" class="">ring</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> her <st data-num="0639" class="">nose</st> and the <st data-num="06781" class="">bracelets</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> her <st data-num="03027" class="">wrists</st>.
Then I bowed down and worshiped the Lord. I praised the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, who had led me on the right path to find the granddaughter of my master’s brother for his son.
Now, if you will show faithful love to my master, tell me. But if not, tell me as well, so that I may go on my way.”
Then Laban and Bethuel replied, “This is the Lord’s doing. Our wishes are of no concern.
Rebekah stands here before you. Take her and go so that she may become the wife of your master’s son, just as the Lord has decided.”
When Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed down to the ground before the Lord.

Then <st data-num="05650" class="">he</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03318" class="">brought out</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">jewelry</st>, and <st data-num="0899" class="">clothing</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> them to <st data-num="07259" class="">Rebekah</st>. He also <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="04030" class="">valuable gifts</st> to her <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> and to her <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st>.

After this, he and the men who were with him ate a meal and stayed there overnight.

When they got up in the morning, he said, “Let me leave now so I can return to my master.”

But Rebekah’s<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> and her <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “Let the <st data-num="05291" class="">girl</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">stay</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> us a few more <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>, <st data-num="0176" class="">perhaps</st> <st data-num="06218" class="">ten</st>. <st data-num="0310" class="">Then</st> she can <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st>.”
But he said to them, “Don’t detain me—the Lord has granted me success on my journey. Let me leave now so I may return to my master.”

Then they <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “We’ll <st data-num="07121" class="">call</st> the <st data-num="05291" class="">girl</st> and <st data-num="07592" class="">find out</st> <st data-num="06310" class="">what</st> she <st data-num="06310" class="">wants to do</st>.”<n id="1" />
So they called Rebekah and asked her, “Do you want to go with this man?” She replied, “I want to go.”
So they sent their sister Rebekah on her way, accompanied by her female attendant, with Abraham’s servant and his men.

They blessed Rebekah with these words:

“Our sister, may you become the mother of thousands of ten thousands!

May your descendants possess the strongholds of their enemies.”
Then Rebekah and her female servants mounted the camels and rode away with the man. So Abraham’s servant took Rebekah and left.
Now Isaac came from Beer Lahai Roi, for he was living in the Negev.

<st data-num="03327" class="">He</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03318" class="">went out</st> to <st data-num="07742" class="">relax</st><n id="2" /> in the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st> in the <st data-num="06437" class="">early</st> <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>.<n id="3" /> Then he <st data-num="05375 05869">looked up</st><n id="4" /> and <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> that<n id="5" /> <st data-num="02009" class="">there</st> were <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">approaching</st>.

<st data-num="07259" class="">Rebekah</st> <st data-num="05375 05869">looked up</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> <st data-num="03327" class="">Isaac</st>. She <st data-num="05307" class="">got down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> her <st data-num="01581" class="">camel</st>
and asked Abraham’s servant, “Who is that man walking in the field toward us?” “That is my master,” the servant replied. So she took her veil and covered herself.
The servant told Isaac everything that had happened.
Then Isaac brought Rebekah into his mother Sarah’s tent. He took her as his wife and loved her. So Isaac was comforted after his mother’s death.
